3769231;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2021-10-20T10:00:00+02:00;2021-10-20T12:00:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3760531;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-10-20T12:30:00+02:00;2021-10-20T14:30:00+02:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3749479;Introduktion til ArcGIS Online;FALSE;2021-10-26T09:30:00+02:00;2021-10-26T11:30:00+02:00;"

Dette kursus er en kort og praktisk introduktion til at bruge ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS Online kan benyttes til at bygge og udgive online kort og apps, hvis du har dine data velstrukturet og organiseret i et regneark.
Kurset handler om følgende emner:
<ul>

column2: • Hvordan man strukturer data for at kunne blive anvendet til visualiseringer i ArcGIS Online
• Hvordan man producerer en ArcGIS Online web app

column1: Kurset tager udgangspunkt i data, der stammer fra en folketælling, og på den måde er kurset oplagt for studerende fra historie og etnologi, men alle er selvfølgelig velkommen og der vil også være tid til at snakke om, hvordan du skal struktuere dine data, hvis du vil lave kort og apps ud fra dine kilder.

Inden kurset begynder modtager tilmeldte deltagere et link til ArcGIS Online, en zipfil med data og et mødelink.

3759638;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2021-10-26T13:00:00+02:00;2021-10-26T15:00:00+02:00;"

Important notice: Due to renovations, The Faculty Library of Social Sciences is unfortunately closed at the moment. The course will therefore be moved to “KUB Nord”, Nørre Allé 49. (Only 5-10 minutes away by bike or bus.)
Please note: This course will take place in English (unless all attendees prefer it in Danish).
Introduction to NVivo. A programme, which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac.﻿
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3750612;Forskerstudiegruppe: Python og digital humaniora - Fokus på Pandas Dataframes;FALSE;2021-10-29T09:00:00+02:00;2021-10-29T11:00:00+02:00;"

Denne workshop foregår i regi af en studiegruppe for forskere med interesse i digital humaniora og hovedsageligt litteraturstudier. Studiegruppen mødes cirka fire gange hvert semester med det formål at udforske digitale metoder. Udforskningen foregår dels gennem kodning og konkret anvendelse, dels gennem samtaler om metodernes udfordringer og potentialer.
En typisk workshop tager to timer, foregår online, og der er ikke forberedelse forbundet dermed.

For mere information om studiegruppen kontakt venligst Lars Kjær, lakj@kb.dk, der er gruppens tovholder.

S;NA;32027;Datalab;9876;Lars Kjær;Lars Kjær;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;NA;FALSE;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;#18E0F2;;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3759832;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-11-02T10:00:00+01:00;2021-11-02T12:00:00+01:00;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course in Nvivo for your literature reviews. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo that introduce basic functions are also available, such as NVivo - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). There will be some overlap between the courses.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo 1.0 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus only on Nvivo in literature reviews using articles in PDF form.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications and working with code books.

• Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memoing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies, matrices and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Adress: KUB Nord - Natur og Sundhedsvidenskab, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)

3759832;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-11-02T10:00:00+01:00;2021-11-02T12:00:00+01:00;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course in Nvivo for your literature reviews. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo that introduce basic functions are also available, such as NVivo - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). There will be some overlap between the courses.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo 1.0 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus only on Nvivo in literature reviews using articles in PDF form.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications and working with code books.

• Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memoing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies, matrices and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Adress: KUB Nord - Natur og Sundhedsvidenskab, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N

/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)

3769232;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2021-11-02T10:00:00+01:00;2021-11-02T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3760533;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-11-03T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-03T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3759646;NVivo og interviewdata;FALSE;2021-11-03T13:00:00+01:00;2021-11-03T15:30:00+01:00;"

Dette kursus er ikke et introducerende kursus, men forudsætter en grundlæggende forståelse for NVivos funktioner.
Denne forståelse kan evt. fås via deltagelse i vores introducerende NVivo-kurser, som findes her:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
Vi kommer til at arbejde med transkribering af lydfiler, brug af cases og import af transkriberede interviews.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3749469;Python og Digital Humaniora - Online grundkursus;FALSE;2021-11-04T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-04T14:30:00+01:00;"

Kurset hedder 'Python og Digital Humaniora', men studerende fra alle fag er meget velkommen til at tilmelde sig.

Formålet er primært at få en god oplevelse og sekundært at lære lidt om, hvordan man kan benytte programmeringssproget Python inden for fag, hvor man arbejder typisk arbejder med tekster som datagrundlag, f.eks. humaniora, teologi, jura, samfunds- og sundsfag.
Vi bruger Jupyter notebook, der er en del af en pakke, der hedder Anaconda, som man inden kurset skal have downloadet og installeret herfra:
https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
Cirka 24 timer inden kursusstart vil tilmeldte deltagere via mail modtage mødelink og materiale i en zipfil til brug på workshoppen.

NB:. Kurset starter på det angivende klokkeslet og ikke efter et akademisk kvarter.

3768376;CANCELLED: Introduction to OpenRefine – how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-11-04T13:00:00+01:00;2021-11-04T14:00:00+01:00;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises that we will use at the course (to be uploadet)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (to be uploaded)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information

Please note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3768376;CANCELLED: Introduction to OpenRefine – how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-11-04T13:00:00+01:00;2021-11-04T14:00:00+01:00;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises that we will use at the course (to be uploadet)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (to be uploaded)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information

Please note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3760534;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-11-10T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-10T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3811855;Datalab Symposium i København - begrænset antal pladser til studerende!;FALSE;2021-11-11T09:30:00+01:00;2021-11-11T15:30:00+01:00;"

Er du interesseret i datascience, kodning, machine learning og dataanalyser? - Så tilmeld dig til Datalab Symposium, som giver dig indblik i Datalab og inspiration til at arbejde med data.
Datalab Symposium byder på inspirationsoplæg, live-kodning, aktiviteter og netværk mellem deltagerne til dagen.

Vi får besøg af af både Data Science Lab og SUND DataLab fra Københavns Universitet. Derudover kan i se frem til et spændende fagligt oplæg af Morten Arendt Rasmussen, Associate Professor på Institut for Fødevarevidenskab.  Morten Arendt Rasmussen underviser i kemometri og analytiske metoder, og er en af de fem forsker som har modtaget Novo Nordisk Fonden’s Science Investigator-bevillinger.
Program til hele dagen:
Der vil være kaffe og forplejning til hele dagen.
Adresse: Københavns Universitetsbibliotek - Andreas Friis Salen, Nørre Allé 49 2200 København N.
Tilmelding til arrangementet

Har du spørgsmål til arrangementet er du velkommen til at skrive til Halle Rashdan - hara@kb.dk

3749474;Python og Digital Humaniora - videregående online kursus med fokus på Pandas;FALSE;2021-11-11T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-11T14:30:00+01:00;"

Kurset hedder 'Python og Digital Humaniora', men studerende fra alle fag er meget velkommmen til at tilmelde sig.
På de videregående kurser handler det om Python-biblioteker som Pandas, sklearn, Seaborn og BeautifulSoup, og det kan hurtigt virke lidt kompliceret.

Men ligesom på de grundlæggende kurser er formålet er primært at få en god oplevelse og sekundært at lære lidt om, hvordan man kan benytte programmeringssproget Python inden for fag, hvor man arbejder typisk arbejder med tekster som datagrundlag, f.eks. humaniora, teologi, jura, samfunds- og sundsfag.
Vi bruger Jupyter notebook, der er en del af en pakke, der hedder Anaconda, som man inden kurset skal have downloadet og installeret herfra: https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
Cirka 24 timer inden kursusstart vil tilmeldte deltagere via mail modtage mødelink og materiale i en zipfil til brug på workshoppen.

NB:. Kurset starter på det angivende klokkeslet og ikke efter et akademisk kvarter.

3759831;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-11-17T10:00:00+01:00;2021-11-17T12:00:00+01:00;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course in Nvivo for your literature reviews. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo that introduce basic functions are also available, such as NVivo - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). There will be some overlap between the courses.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo 1.0 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus only on Nvivo in literature reviews using articles in PDF form.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications and working with code books.

• Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memoing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies, matrices and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)

3813031;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2021-11-22T12:00:00+01:00;2021-11-22T14:00:00+01:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019)

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019)

3759640;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2021-11-23T10:30:00+01:00;2021-11-23T12:30:00+01:00;"
Please note: This course will take place in English (unless all attendees prefer it in Danish).
Introduction to NVivo. A programme, which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac.﻿
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3760536;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-11-24T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-24T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3759625;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-11-25T10:30:00+01:00;2021-11-25T12:30:00+01:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3769233;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2021-11-30T12:30:00+01:00;2021-11-30T14:30:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3748950;Datasprint: data(Tinget) - demokrati og politiske forhandlinger i Folketinget;FALSE;2021-12-02T09:00:00+01:00;2021-12-02T17:00:00+01:00;"

BEMÆRK: Dette arrangement løber over to dage: 2. og 3. december. Tilmelding er således gældende for begge dage.

Endnu en gang inviterer universitetsbibliotekerne ved Det Kgl. Bibliotek til datasprint, hvor du kan prøve kræfter med digitale metoder som data wrangling og tekst- og datamining. Temaet er demokrati og politiske forhandlinger i Folketinget, og vi inviterer studerende og ansatte ved universiteterne med til at behandle temaet med udgangspunkt i Folketingets forhandlinger fra 1953 til 2021.

Datasprintet kan du betragte som et begynderkursus, hvor indholdet er tilrettelagt, således at alle kan deltage uden forudgående programmeringserfaring. Der er ingen forberedelse, og det handler ikke om at præstere, men primært om at få en god oplevelse og sekundært om at lære lidt om tekst- og datamining. For de fleste deltagere vil tekst- og datamining være helt nyt, og derfor kan du forvente at blive konfronteret med ukendte ord og begreber.

En god portion nysgerrighed, overbærenhed og ‘gå-på-mod’ er vigtige forudsætninger for at bruge datasprintet til at lære noget nyt, mens præstationsbehov og perfektionisme sandsynligvis vil hæmme indlæringen. Deltager du på datasprintet vil du gennem praktiske øvelser skridt for skridt blive introduceret til tekst- og datamining teknikker, samt programmeringssprogene Python og R.
Datasprintet finder sted dels på Den sorte Diamant, dels på Christiansborg, og du kan læse mere om datasprintet her:

https://datasprint2021.kb.dk/

3748950;Datasprint: data(Tinget) - demokrati og politiske forhandlinger i Folketinget;FALSE;2021-12-02T09:00:00+01:00;2021-12-02T17:00:00+01:00;"

BEMÆRK: Dette arrangement løber over to dage: 2. og 3. december. Tilmelding er således gældende for begge dage.

Endnu en gang inviterer universitetsbibliotekerne ved Det Kgl. Bibliotek til datasprint, hvor du kan prøve kræfter med digitale metoder som data wrangling og tekst- og datamining. Temaet er demokrati og politiske forhandlinger i Folketinget, og vi inviterer studerende og ansatte ved universiteterne med til at behandle temaet med udgangspunkt i Folketingets forhandlinger fra 1953 til 2021.

Datasprintet kan du betragte som et begynderkursus, hvor indholdet er tilrettelagt, således at alle kan deltage uden forudgående programmeringserfaring. Der er ingen forberedelse, og det handler ikke om at præstere, men primært om at få en god oplevelse og sekundært om at lære lidt om tekst- og datamining. For de fleste deltagere vil tekst- og datamining være helt nyt, og derfor kan du forvente at blive konfronteret med ukendte ord og begreber.

En god portion nysgerrighed, overbærenhed og ‘gå-på-mod’ er vigtige forudsætninger for at bruge datasprintet til at lære noget nyt, mens præstationsbehov og perfektionisme sandsynligvis vil hæmme indlæringen. Deltager du på datasprintet vil du gennem praktiske øvelser skridt for skridt blive introduceret til tekst- og datamining teknikker, samt programmeringssprogene Python og R.
Datasprintet finder sted dels på Den sorte Diamant, dels på Christiansborg, og du kan læse mere om datasprintet her:

https://datasprint2021.kb.dk/

3813033;AFLYST Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2021-12-02T12:00:00+01:00;2021-12-02T14:30:00+01:00;"<div id=""s-lc-event-desc"">

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019)

Related LibGuide: KUB Datalab by Halle Rashdan

3759650;NVivo and interview data (English);FALSE;2021-12-07T10:30:00+01:00;2021-12-07T13:00:00+01:00;"

This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can optionally be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of cases, and import of transcribed interviews.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3759650;NVivo and interview data (English);FALSE;2021-12-07T10:30:00+01:00;2021-12-07T13:00:00+01:00;"

This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can optionally be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of cases, and import of transcribed interviews.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3813304;R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE;FALSE;2021-12-08T10:00:00+01:00;2021-12-08T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3760538;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-12-08T12:30:00+01:00;2021-12-08T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3750628;Forskerstudiegruppe: Python og digital humaniora - Fokus på Machine Learning;FALSE;2021-12-10T09:00:00+01:00;2021-12-10T11:00:00+01:00;"

Denne workshop foregår i regi af en studiegruppe for forskere med interesse i digital humaniora og hovedsageligt litteraturstudier. Studiegruppen mødes cirka fire gange hvert semester med det formål at udforske digitale metoder. Udforskningen foregår dels gennem kodning og konkret anvendelse, dels gennem samtaler om metodernes udfordringer og potentialer.
En typisk workshop tager to timer, foregår online, og der er ikke forberedelse forbundet dermed.

For mere information om studiegruppen kontakt venligst Lars Kjær, lakj@kb.dk, der er gruppens tovholder.

3768375;CANCELLED: Online introduction to OpenRefine – how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-12-16T11:00:00+01:00;2021-12-16T12:00:00+01:00;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises that we will use at the course (to be uploadet)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (to be uploaded)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3837325;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-02-04T10:30:00+01:00;2022-02-04T12:30:00+01:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3837381;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-02-08T10:30:00+01:00;2022-02-08T12:30:00+01:00;"

Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3842349;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-02-10T10:30:00+01:00;2022-02-10T12:30:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. In the Software Library download "NVivo 13 for Windows" or "NVivo for Mac M1chip (you do not need a M1-chip). You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager.
Please find more information about how to prepare for the course HERE.
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). The introductory course is offered multiple times throughout the year in both Danish and English. If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3842349;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3842349;0;0;;NA;NA;;33562;Analysis;38777;Lorna Wildgaard;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;15;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;15;5;0;0;5;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1625473832.png;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3842349;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-02-10T10:30:00+01:00;2022-02-10T12:30:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3842349;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3842349;0;0;;NA;NA;;33563;Visualisation;38777;Lorna Wildgaard;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;15;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;15;5;0;0;5;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1625473832.png;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3829433;Datasprint: The political debate in Europe illuminated through text and data mining;FALSE;2022-02-10T14:00:00+01:00;2022-02-10T19:00:00+01:00;"

Come and participate in our datasprint, where we will go from data to results in less than two days while having a good time.
NB: Participants in this data sprint are expected to have at least a fundamental knowledge of Python programming and data structuring in Python.

We invite students to take part in the exploration of the dataset “‘Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1’”. (Erjavec, Tomaž; et al., 2021, Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1, Slovenian language resource repository CLARIN.SI, http://hdl.handle.net/11356/1432)
The ‘Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1’ is a unique opportunity to look inside the different national Parliament of Europe.

Participants will be divided into groups. In the groups, you must decide for a relevant question that you can examine and answer with data. You have about 10 hours to answer the question and to prepare a presentation of 5-7 min, which must contain 3 - 5 graphs / visualizations.

A relevant question could for example deal with the distribution of age, gender, political parties or it could be an analysis of the speeches. The dataset is highly structured. Row after row of speeches representing the political attitudes and agendas of parties and politicians from 2015 to 2020. Beside speeches, you will find metadata about the politicians, for example, speakers name, gender, party affiliation, data of birth etc.
The Datasprint will take place Thursday, February 10, from 2 pm. to 7 pm. and Friday, February 11, from 9 am. to 3 pm.
The datasprint is organized jointly by Copenhagen University Library Datalab (KUB Datalab) and The Master programme in social data science (SDS).
Registration deadline: January 23, 2022
Register here.

3829435;Datasprint: The political debate in Europe illuminated through text and data mining;FALSE;2022-02-11T09:00:00+01:00;2022-02-11T15:00:00+01:00;"

Come and participate in our datasprint, where we will go from data to results in less than two days while having a good time.
NB: Participants in this data sprint are expected to have at least a fundamental knowledge of Python programming and data structuring in Python.

We invite students to take part in the exploration of the dataset “‘Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1’”. (Erjavec, Tomaž; et al., 2021, Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1, Slovenian language resource repository CLARIN.SI, http://hdl.handle.net/11356/1432)
The ‘Multilingual comparable corpora of parliamentary debates ParlaMint 2.1’ is a unique opportunity to look inside the different national Parliament of Europe.

Participants will be divided into groups. In the groups, you must decide for a relevant question that you can examine and answer with data. You have about 10 hours to answer the question and to prepare a presentation of 5-7 min, which must contain 3 - 5 graphs / visualizations.

A relevant question could for example deal with the distribution of age, gender, political parties or it could be an analysis of the speeches. The dataset is highly structured. Row after row of speeches representing the political attitudes and agendas of parties and politicians from 2015 to 2020. Beside speeches, you will find metadata about the politicians, for example, speakers name, gender, party affiliation, data of birth etc.
The Datasprint will take place Thursday, February 10, from 2 pm. to 7 pm. and Friday, February 11, from 9 am. to 3 pm.
The datasprint is organized jointly by Copenhagen University Library Datalab (KUB Datalab) and The Master programme in social data science (SDS).
Registration deadline: January 23, 2022
Register here.

3843505;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2022-02-16T10:00:00+01:00;2022-02-16T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3832904;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-02-16T12:30:00+01:00;2022-02-16T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3853316;NVivo and interview data (English);FALSE;2022-02-28T10:30:00+01:00;2022-02-28T13:00:00+01:00;"

This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can optionally be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of cases, and import of transcribed interviews.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
Please note: We will be working in the newest version of NVivo which in the Sotware Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and/or "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (you do not need an M1-chip).
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of cases, and import of transcribed interviews.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
Please note: We will be working in the newest version of NVivo which in the Sotware Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and/or "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (you do not need an M1-chip).
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3837377;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-03-01T12:30:00+01:00;2022-03-01T14:30:00+01:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3832906;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-03-02T12:30:00+01:00;2022-03-02T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3862229;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-03-08T13:00:00+01:00;2022-03-08T15:00:00+01:00;"

Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3842351;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-03-15T12:30:00+01:00;2022-03-15T14:30:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. In the Software Library download "NVivo 13 for Windows" or "NVivo for Mac M1chip (you do not need a M1-chip). You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager.
Please find more information about how to prepare for the course HERE.
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). The introductory course is offered multiple times throughout the year in both Danish and English. If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3842351;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3842351;0;0;;NA;NA;;32027;Datalab;38777;Lorna Wildgaard;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;22;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;22;19;0;0;19;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571789.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3842351;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-03-15T12:30:00+01:00;2022-03-15T14:30:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. In the Software Library download "NVivo 13 for Windows" or "NVivo for Mac M1chip (you do not need a M1-chip). You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager.
Please find more information about how to prepare for the course HERE.
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

3832908;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-03-16T12:30:00+01:00;2022-03-16T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3864128;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2022-03-28T10:00:00+02:00;2022-03-28T12:30:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3844614;Digital humaniora og programmering 1;FALSE;2022-03-29T10:00:00+02:00;2022-03-29T12:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår grundlæggende Python-kode, der kan få dig i gang med at bruge programmering som redskab til tekstbehandling, kvantitative analyser og tekst- og datamining.

Mere teknisk fortalt gennemgår vi begreber som variabler, værdier, datatyperne tekststrenge og lister, løkker og import af pakker. Samtidigt lærer du om at klargøre tekster til digital tekstanalyse, og eftersom vi benytter python-programmet Jupyter Notebook, så opnår du også et kendskab til det.

3843148;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2022-03-30T10:00:00+02:00;2022-03-30T12:30:00+02:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i form af tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:

Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365). Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte. Det finder sted i DSSL, underetagen, på biblioteket på Gothersgade.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).
KU Absalonrum for Excel for samfundsvidenskab åbner senere.

Vi skifter til Zoom, hvis COVID-situationen forhindrer fysisk undervisning. Vi glæder os til at se dig.

3837382;Online: NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-03-31T12:00:00+02:00;2022-03-31T14:30:00+02:00;"

Please note: This course will be held online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3881139;Digital humaniora og programmering 1;FALSE;2022-04-01T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-01T12:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår grundlæggende Python-kode, der kan få dig i gang med at bruge programmering som redskab til tekstbehandling, kvantitative analyser og tekst- og datamining.

Mere teknisk fortalt gennemgår vi begreber som variabler, værdier, datatyperne tekststrenge og lister, løkker og import af pakker. Samtidigt lærer du om at klargøre tekster til digital tekstanalyse, og eftersom vi benytter python-programmet Jupyter Notebook, så opnår du også et kendskab til det.

3864129;R and Statistics Denmark;FALSE;2022-04-04T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-04T12:30:00+02:00;"

Statistics Denmark provides access to a multitude of information.
In this course we cover how to efficiently extract data though the API provided by Statistics Denmark.
The course requeres some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself

column1: These topics are covered in the course: R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version, held on March 28.

PLEASE NOTE. The first hour of this course will consist of a refresher of the topics mentioned above. If you feel confident with them, you can skip the first hour and show up at 11.00.

3844623;Digital humaniora og programmering 2;FALSE;2022-04-05T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-05T12:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår, hvordan man søge i tekster ved hjælp af ’regulære udtryk’. Regulære udtryk er super smarte, fordi man kan bruge dem til at trække udvalgte stykker tekst ud af en større tekstsamling, og på den måde er regulære udtryk meget anvendelige i forhold til tekst- og datamining. Udfordringen er at lære at formulere de regulære udtryk, men når man kommer i gang med udfordringen, er det sjovt, ’krøllet’ og spændende at opleve, hvordan man utroligt hurtigt kan fremfinde de passager i tekster, som man er interesseret i. Python understøtter regulære udtryk, så det er Python, der er kursets udgangspunkt. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurset Digital humaniora og programmering 1.

3843506;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2022-04-05T12:30:00+02:00;2022-04-05T14:30:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3832911;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-04-06T12:30:00+02:00;2022-04-06T14:30:00+02:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3837380;NVivo and interview data (English);FALSE;2022-04-06T12:30:00+02:00;2022-04-06T15:00:00+02:00;"

This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can optionally be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab
We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of cases, and import of transcribed interviews.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
Please note: We will be working in the newest version of NVivo which in the Sotware Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and/or "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (you do not need an M1-chip).
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3842352;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-04-07T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-07T12:00:00+02:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. In the Software Library download "NVivo 13 for Windows" or "NVivo for Mac M1chip (you do not need a M1-chip). You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager.
Please find more information about how to prepare for the course HERE.
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). The introductory course is offered multiple times throughout the year in both Danish and English. If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

3843149;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2022-04-08T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-08T12:30:00+02:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data som tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:

Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365). NB.: Vi, underviserne, bruger Excel 2016. Version 365 er anderledes, og dét vil drille. Vi opgraderer til 365 inden næste semester (det er ikke muligt endnu desværre).

Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte. Det finder sted i DSSL, underetagen, på biblioteket på Gothersgade.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).
KU Absalonrum for Excel for samfundsvidenskab åbner senere.

Vi skifter til Zoom, hvis COVID-situationen forhindrer fysisk undervisning. Vi glæder os til at se dig.

3844624;Digital humaniora og programmering 3;FALSE;2022-04-19T10:00:00+02:00;2022-04-19T12:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår nogle af Python-biblioteket Pandas’ mange muligheder. Pandas er et bibliotek i Python, som man benytter til at arbejde med data, der er struktureret i rækker og kolonner. Man vil ofte vælge at strukturere sine data i rækker og kolonner, hvis man har samlet meget data, og der findes også mange datasæt, som allerede er struktureret således. Med lidt kendskab til Pandas er man godt hjulpet på vej til at kunne give sig i kast med dataanalyse af større datasæt. På kurset gennemgår vi, hvordan man bygger en dataframe, samt hvordan man filtrerer, sammentæller og visualiserer sine data. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurserne Digital humaniora og programmering 1 og 2.

3837379;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-04-21T12:30:00+02:00;2022-04-21T14:30:00+02:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3843150;Excel for social sciences – in English;FALSE;2022-04-22T12:00:00+02:00;2022-04-22T14:30:00+02:00;"

If you want to tackle and master Microsoft Excel then join our workshop at the Library at Gothersgade. Focus is on Excel for study and assignments.
Excel is a strong, flexible tool that can crunch your numbers and analyse and visualize your data and help you show your analysis in your assignments.
We introduce Excel and its basic functions and terminology and move on to advanced functions such as tables and pivots, visualisation and more, working on datasets.
Important and practicalities:

The workshop is for Copenhagen University students. Bring your laptop (Windows/Mac) with Excel installed (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365). Note: We, the instructors, use Excel 2016. Version 365 is different and this will cause some friction. We upgrade to 365 next semester (it's not possible yet, unfortunately).

We spend the first 5-10 minutes updating the Excel software. The workshop is in English. It takes approx. two hours. It requires at least six participants or it is cancelled. The course takes place in DSSL in the lowest floor at the Library at Gothersgade.

We offer at least three courses per semester (most in Danish). If you registered for the workshop but cannot participate after all then kindly remember to unregister. There is often a waiting list. Thank you.
Copenhagen University Absalon room for Excel for social sciences will be up and running later.

We shift to Zoom if the COVID situation does not permit physical classes. We are looking forward to seeing you.
