3864723;Data Carpentry for Humanities - 1;FALSE;2022-04-26T09:00:00+02:00;2022-04-26T16:00:00+02:00;"

Unfortunately, the workshop is being postponed until the beginning of September due to too few people signing up.

Data Carpentry gives you the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. The workshop is for students and researchers who have little to no prior computational experience, and the aim is for you to quickly apply skills learned during the workshop to your own research. ”Read more about the Data Carpentry workshop on our website: https://kubdatalab.github.io/2022-04-26-DC-HUM/
Program:
Day 1 (preparing and cleaning data)
<ul>
Day 2 (Analysis)
<ul>

column2: • Late afternoon: Inspiration to how one can work with the data, fx picture analysis using data from KB collection, creating maps, visualisation.

column1: Time and place
The workshop will be over two days, the 26th of April and the 3rd of May. Both days from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.
At room 4a.1.60, Njalsgade 76, 2300 Copenhagen S

NB: Since we want to order refreshments registration for the workshop on 26th of April must be before 20th of April, and registration for the workshop on 3rd of May must be before 27th of April.

3888087;Digital humaniora og programmering - ekstra kursus i Python Pandas;FALSE;2022-05-02T10:00:00+02:00;2022-05-02T12:00:00+02:00;"

På workshoppen gennemgår vi et begrænset udvalg af de muligheder, som Python biblioteket Pandas byder på.

Pandas bruger man ofte, hvis man har fået udleveret et datasæt, der er struktureret i rækker og kolonner, eller hvis man har data, som man har behov for at få strukturert på den måde. Det kan f.eks. være en folketælling.

Eksempeldatasættet til denne workshop er en digitaliseret folketælling fra Jomfruøerne stillet til rådighed af Rigsarkivet.

3843507;R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE;FALSE;2022-05-10T10:00:00+02:00;2022-05-10T12:00:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3843507;R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE;FALSE;2022-05-10T10:00:00+02:00;2022-05-10T12:00:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3837378;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-05-10T10:30:00+02:00;2022-05-10T12:30:00+02:00;"

Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3848768;Lær digital humaniora og den kvantitative tilgang til tekstanalyse med Voyant tools;FALSE;2022-05-17T09:30:00+02:00;2022-05-17T13:30:00+02:00;"

Ved hjælp af en mængde digitale tekster, en computer og den rette teknologi kan man iagttage trends i et helt århundrede og måle og veje indhold i litteratur.

Kurset handler om den kvantitative tilgang til tekstanalyse, hvordan man måler, hvor meget forskellige ord og begreber udgør af tekster, dels med henblik på at iagttage trends på et overordnet niveau, dels med henblik på at differentiere tekster og begreber fra hinanden.

Kurset giver indblik i forskellige tilgange og begreber, der knytter sig til den kvantitative tilgang, og man vil lærer at bruge et genialt program, der hedder Voyant Tools, som er gratis og let tilgængeligt.
Som eksempel-datasæt anvendes en stor samling af 1800tals romaner, der indeholder gyser-elementer i forskellig grad.

Undervejs i kurset vil lektor Robert William Rix fra engelsk på Engerom holde et spændende oplæg om, hvordan han har benyttet sig af Voyant Tools til at analysere trends i 1800tallets gotiske skrækromaner.
Programmet ser således ud:
9:30 – 11:00
Introduktion til Voyant Tools’ grænseflade
11:00 – 11:15
Pause
11:15 – 12:00
’Det var en mørk, dyster vinteraften …’  eller trends i 1800tallets gyserhistorier.
Oplæg og dialog om Voyant Tools ved lektor Robert William Rix
12:00 – 12:30
Pause
12:30 – 13:30

Udforskning af og dialog om Voyant Tools

3844643;Digital humaniora og programmering 1 - Python;FALSE;2022-05-24T09:00:00+02:00;2022-05-24T11:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår grundlæggende Python-kode, der kan få dig i gang med at bruge programmering som redskab til tekstbehandling, kvantitative analyser og tekst- og datamining.

Mere teknisk fortalt gennemgår vi begreber som variabler, værdier, datatyperne tekststrenge og lister, løkker og import af pakker. Samtidigt lærer du om at klargøre tekster til digital tekstanalyse, og eftersom vi benytter python-programmet Jupyter Notebook, så opnår du også et kendskab til det.

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3844643;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3844643;14429;0;KUB Datalab - Sdr Campus;39;KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S;NA;32027;Datalab;9876;Lars Kjær;Lars Kjær;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;17;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;17;12;0;0;12;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1650620857.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3844644;Digital humaniora og programmering 2 - Python;FALSE;2022-05-24T11:30:00+02:00;2022-05-24T13:30:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår, hvordan man søge i tekster ved hjælp af ’regulære udtryk’. Regulære udtryk er super smarte, fordi man kan bruge dem til at trække udvalgte stykker tekst ud af en større tekstsamling, og på den måde er regulære udtryk meget anvendelige i forhold til tekst- og datamining. Udfordringen er at lære at formulere de regulære udtryk, men når man kommer i gang med udfordringen, er det sjovt, ’krøllet’ og spændende at opleve, hvordan man utroligt hurtigt kan fremfinde de passager i tekster, som man er interesseret i. Python understøtter regulære udtryk, så det er Python, der er kursets udgangspunkt. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurset Digital humaniora og programmering 1.

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3844644;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3844644;14429;0;KUB Datalab - Sdr Campus;39;KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S;NA;32027;Datalab;9876;Lars Kjær;Lars Kjær;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;15;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;15;10;0;0;10;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1650620857.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3844645;Digital humaniora og programmering 3 - Python;FALSE;2022-05-24T14:00:00+02:00;2022-05-24T16:00:00+02:00;"

Kurset gennemgår nogle af Python-biblioteket Pandas’ mange muligheder. Pandas er et bibliotek i Python, som man benytter til at arbejde med data, der er struktureret i rækker og kolonner. Man vil ofte vælge at strukturere sine data i rækker og kolonner, hvis man har samlet meget data, og der findes også mange datasæt, som allerede er struktureret således. Med lidt kendskab til Pandas er man godt hjulpet på vej til at kunne give sig i kast med dataanalyse af større datasæt. På kurset gennemgår vi, hvordan man bygger en dataframe, samt hvordan man filtrerer, sammentæller og visualiserer sine data. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurset Digital humaniora og programmering 1 og 2.

3863325;At kode er at strikke - R workshop;FALSE;2022-06-08T12:00:00+02:00;2022-06-08T15:00:00+02:00;"

’Kan du strikke? Så kan du også kode i R!’  Det lyder måske ’crazy’, men den er god nok. De fleste vil kunne opleve øget mestring af kodning gennem alternativ formidling af de mange spændende historiske og nutidige sammenfald mellem kodning og håndarbejde.

Dette kursus i programmeringssproget R og tekstmining tager udgangspunkt i de principper man kender fra strikning, fordi dem kan vi bruge, når vi lærer, hvordan vi kan skrive tekstminingskode, som vi kan bruge til at analysere og skabe overblik over mønstre i datasamlinger.
Workshoppen er målrettet studerende, der ikke har erfaring med kodning, men gerne vil blive data-hjemmevant i bl.a. text mining, R, databehandling- og visualisering. Alle interesserede er velkomne!

Workshoppen er organiseret af KUB Datalab i samarbejde med informationsspecialisterne Max Odsbjerg Pedersen og Karoline Liv Vildlyng fra AUL (Aarhus University Library), der også leder workshoppen.

3908855;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2022-08-31T10:00:00+02:00;2022-08-31T12:00:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3907148;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-09-07T10:00:00+02:00;2022-09-07T12:00:00+02:00;"
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3864724;Data Carpentry for Humanities;FALSE;2022-09-08T09:00:00+02:00;2022-09-08T16:00:00+02:00;"

Text Mining for humanists:
Join our Data Carpentry workshop from September 8th - 9th
YOU ONLY NEED TO REGISTER ONCE. THIS IS A TWO DAY EVENT AND THE REGISTRATION FORM SIGNS YOU UP FOR BOTH THE 8TH AND THE 9TH OF SEPTEMBER.

Data Carpentry gives you the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. This workshop is aimed at students and researchers within the humanities with little to no prior computanional experience. Do you work with large sets of text data and want to learn the basics of digital text analysis/ text-mining in Python?

Python is a programming language which is ideal for humanistic research and the aim of the workshop is for you to quickly apply skills learned to your own project. Read more about this Data Carpentry workshop on our website: https://tinyurl.com/2p86y244
Programme:
Day 1 (preparing and cleaning data)
<ul>
Day 2 (Analysis)
<ul>

column2: • Late afternoon: Inspiration to how one can work with the data, fx picture analysis using data from the royal library's collection, creating maps, visualisation and much more.

column1: Time and place
The workshop will be over two days, the 8th and the 9th of September. Both days from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Location: Copenhagen University South Campus, Room 27.0.49, Njalsgade 80, 2300 Copenhagen S

NB: Since we will order refreshments for both workshops, we kindly ask the participants to register before 4th September. If you want to register after the 4th September, please write to lowi@kb.dk.

3906788;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-09-12T10:30:00+02:00;2022-09-12T12:30:00+02:00;"
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3908863;R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE;FALSE;2022-09-15T13:00:00+02:00;2022-09-15T15:00:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.
Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

Link to online participation will be mailed to you two days before the course.

Det vil sige:
<ul role=""list"">

column2: <li 335552541="""" aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""1"" data-font=""Calibri"" data-leveltext=""-"" data-list-defn-props=""{"">

3907149;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-09-20T10:30:00+02:00;2022-09-20T12:30:00+02:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3907837;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-09-21T12:30:00+02:00;2022-09-21T14:30:00+02:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3908856;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2022-09-22T10:00:00+02:00;2022-09-22T12:30:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3908746;Introduction to programming with Python I;FALSE;2022-09-22T12:30:00+02:00;2022-09-22T15:00:00+02:00;"

This is the first part of two. We will cover the essential concepts of Python programming, at the end of the lecture, you should be able to write simple Python programs. No prior knowledge of programming or Python is required, but we will cover a lot of topics, so the lecture will be fast paced.

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3908746;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3908746;4360;0;KUB Nørre Campus: Data Lab;41;KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N;NA;32027;Datalab;30747;Henrik Hornemann;Henrik Hornemann;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;20;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;20;6;0;0;6;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://libapps-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/customers/105/images/Python_logo.jpg;NA;0;

The lecture will be in english, unless all of the participants speak danish, in which case it will be in danish.

3908929;Workshop: Øg kendskabet til text mining med regulære udtryk i Python;FALSE;2022-09-23T09:00:00+02:00;2022-09-23T11:00:00+02:00;"

Workshoppens formål er at blive lidt klogere på, hvordan man bruger regulære udtryk (regex) i sin Python kode. Regex er super smart at kende til, hvis man vil i gang med text mining.

Workshoppen foregår i undervisningslokalet på Søndre Campus.

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3908929;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3908929;92;0;KUB Søndre Campus: Undervisningslokalet 1. sal;39;KUB Søndre Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Kbh. S;NA;32027;Datalab;9876;Lars Kjær;Lars Kjær & Daniel Pryn;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;20;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;20;16;0;0;16;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://libapps-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/customers/105/images/Python_logo.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA
Dette kursus er ikke et introducerende kursus, men forudsætter en grundlæggende forståelse for NVivos funktioner.
Denne forståelse kan evt. fås via deltagelse i vores introducerende NVivo-kurser, som findes her:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab
Vi kommer til at arbejde med transkribering af lydfiler, brug af cases og import af transkriberede interviews.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip).
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3906818;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3906818;0;0;;40;KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K;NA;32027;Datalab;28221;Daniel Pryn;Daniel Pryn & Erik Schwägermann;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;22;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;22;14;0;0;14;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571561.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3907905;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-09-27T10:00:00+02:00;2022-09-27T12:00:00+02:00;"

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In the workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" we focus on literature reviews using PDF articles as the data source, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: revising the coding structure, creating sets, working with annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes and documenting your work

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. Here you'll find a link to QSR International - Nvivo. Click on the link and accept the agreement.  You can now start the download and installation process. You'll see three text files:
1. Nvivoinstallation.txt - an empty file referring you to the instructions in Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt
2. Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt - follow the instructions in this file to install Nvivo
3. Nvivo_Win-Mac_License key 2022 - Save the licence key where you can find it. You'll need to copy/paste the key in a dialogue box during the installation process
In case of any difficulties in this process, please contact Copenhagen University’s Service desk.
Data needed for the workshop

You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager that are available in the Absalon course room. Please find the Absalon course room and more information about how to prepare for the course HERE.
Workshop design

Instruction in Nvivo on both PC and Mac will be covered during the workshop. However, the teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the Nvivo is not on the same level as the PC version. There are some functions that are not available on the Mac.
<ul>
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

3903856;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2022-09-28T12:15:00+02:00;2022-09-28T14:30:00+02:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data som tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:
Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365).
Vi forventer, at du har grundlæggende computer-færdigheder og erfaring med at bruge Microsoft-office, når du melder dig til kurset.

Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte. Det finder sted i KUB Datalab, underetagen, på biblioteket på Gothersgade.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).
KU Absalonrum for Excel for samfundsvidenskab åbner senere.

3907838;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-09-28T12:30:00+02:00;2022-09-28T14:30:00+02:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3906808;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-10-05T10:00:00+02:00;2022-10-05T12:00:00+02:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3926612;An alternative to Excel: OpenRefine can do really cool stuff;FALSE;2022-10-10T10:00:00+02:00;2022-10-10T12:00:00+02:00;"<div class=""show-content user_content clearfix enhanced"">
An alternative to Excel: OpenRefine can do really cool stuff

MS Excel is a widely used tool for handling tabular data, but can also be a source of frustration. It has even led to a number of “horror stories (Links to an external site.)” of how MS Excel has led to mishaps. See The Turing Way (Links to an external site.) for more "fun". To be fair the best solution may very well be to use OpenRefine and Excel in conjunction as they each have their own strengths and weaknesses.
OpenRefine can help you handle datasets in a different way that does not lead to these kinds of mishaps. OpenRefine can even do stuff that Excel cannot – e.g. make data entries consistent.
This introductory course will show you how to investigate your dataset in terms of e.g.:
<ul>

column2: • merge cells or split cells based on a delimiter or by field length

column1: During the two hour course you will be shown how to use OpenRefine to do the stuff above. The last part of the course you will have time to try out the functions on the dataset I use in my demonstration. You are also welcome to bring your own data that you want to work on.
Preparation for the course:
I expect that you have OpenRefine installed before the course, since we do not have time to do it at the course. See here how to install OpenRefine.
After the course:

After the intro you can pick up the course manual and the dataset used in the course here. See and repeat the steps we took at your own pace. NB: the material is not available until after the introduction :-)

3906810;ONLINE: NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-10-10T12:30:00+02:00;2022-10-10T15:00:00+02:00;"
Please note: This course will be held online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3906810;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3906810;0;0;;NA;NA;;33562;Analysis;28221;Daniel Pryn;Daniel Pryn & Erik Schwägermann;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;50;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;50;22;0;0;22;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571897.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA
3906810;ONLINE: NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-10-10T12:30:00+02:00;2022-10-10T15:00:00+02:00;"
Please note: This course will be held online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3908857;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2022-10-26T10:00:00+02:00;2022-10-26T12:30:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3908857;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2022-10-26T10:00:00+02:00;2022-10-26T12:30:00+02:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

3907842;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-10-26T12:30:00+02:00;2022-10-26T14:30:00+02:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3908955;Kina i Danmark - et datasprint;FALSE;2022-10-27T14:00:00+02:00;2022-10-27T16:00:00+02:00;"

Dataprintet er en workshop om text mining med Python. Vi vil undersøge karakteren af ​​sproget omkring Kina i referaterne fra Folketinget fra 1953 til 2009. Har sproget ændret sig gennem tiden og i så fald, hvornår det har ændret sig, og hvordan det har ændret sig? Vi vil belyse dette ved at undersøge de almindeligste anvendte små ordklynger, hvori Kina indgår i. Små ordklynger er små i størrelse, hvilket gør dem perfekte til digital tekstanalyse. Dataprintet vil introducere let anvendelige text mining teknikker, f.eks. ordfrekvenser, n-grams og 'key word in context'. Gennem dialog og praktisk kodning vil deltagerne få indblik i en ​​kvantitativ tilgang til læsning og på den måde få indtryk af, hvad denne tilgang har at tilbyde.

Datasprintet starter torsdag den 27. oktober kl 14:00 og forsætter til kl. 16:00. Vi begynder med et oplæg om de dansk-kinesiske foreningers historie siden 1948. Oplægget bliver holdt af Kjeld Allan Thrane Larsen, der har været medlem og i perioder formand for bestyrelser i dansk-kinesiske foreninger.
Datasprintet fortsætter fredag den 28. oktober. Vi begynder kl. 9:00 med text mining og forsætter til kl. 16:00.
Nu du tilmelder dig, gælder tilmeldingen for både torsdag og fredag.
Dataprintet er tilrettelagt af:
<ul>

column2: • Lars Kjær, KUB Datalab
• Bo Ærenlund Sørensen, Institut for Tværkulturelle og regionale studier
• Mai Corlin Frederiksen, Institut for Tværkulturelle og regionale studier

3908862;R for Absolute Beginners - in another way;FALSE;2022-10-31T10:00:00+01:00;2022-10-31T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
This is a trial run. Instead of beginning with an introduction to what a variable is, we start by loading some data, plotting and exploring it.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here. Please note that this material is in no way finished yet, as we are still experimenting.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3912427;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-11-02T10:00:00+01:00;2022-11-02T12:00:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. Here you'll find a link to QSR International - Nvivo. Click on the link and accept the agreement.  You can now start the download and installation process. You'll see three text files:
1. Nvivoinstallation.txt - an empty file referring you to the instructions in Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt
2. Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt - follow the instructions in this file to install Nvivo
3. Nvivo_Win-Mac_License key 2022 - Save the licence key where you can find it. You'll need to copy/paste the key in a dialogue box during the installation process
In case of any difficulties in this process, please contact Copenhagen University’s Service desk.
Data needed for the workshop

You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager that are available in the Absalon course room. Please find the Absalon course room and more information about how to prepare for the course HERE
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). The introductory course is offered multiple times throughout the year in both Danish and English. If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3912427;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3912427;0;0;;40;KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K;NA;33562;Analysis;38777;Lorna Wildgaard;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;15;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;15;9;0;0;9;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571789.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3912427;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-11-02T10:00:00+01:00;2022-11-02T12:00:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library. Here you'll find a link to QSR International - Nvivo. Click on the link and accept the agreement.  You can now start the download and installation process. You'll see three text files:
1. Nvivoinstallation.txt - an empty file referring you to the instructions in Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt
2. Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt - follow the instructions in this file to install Nvivo
3. Nvivo_Win-Mac_License key 2022 - Save the licence key where you can find it. You'll need to copy/paste the key in a dialogue box during the installation process
In case of any difficulties in this process, please contact Copenhagen University’s Service desk.
Data needed for the workshop

You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager that are available in the Absalon course room. Please find the Absalon course room and more information about how to prepare for the course HERE

3907843;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-11-02T12:30:00+01:00;2022-11-02T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3907843;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3907843;4360;0;KUB Nørre Campus: Data Lab;41;KUB Nørre Campus, Nørre Allé 49, 2200 København N;NA;33563;Visualisation;16332;Christian Knudsen;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;NA;FALSE;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;#18E0F2;https://libapps-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/customers/105/images/boks_til_ku3.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA
This course is not an introductory course but presupposes a basic understanding of the functionality in NVivo.
This understanding can optionally be gained by participating in our introductory NVivo courses found here:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab
We will be working with transcription of audio files, the use of case classification, and import of transcribed interviews.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.
Please note: We will be working in the newest version of NVivo which in the Sotware Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and/or "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (you do not need an M1-chip).
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3903857;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2022-11-03T12:45:00+01:00;2022-11-03T15:00:00+01:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data som tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:
Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365).
Vi forventer, at du har grundlæggende computer-færdigheder og erfaring med at bruge Microsoft-office, når du melder dig til kurset.

Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte. Det finder sted i KUB Datalab, underetagen, på biblioteket på Gothersgade.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).
KU Absalonrum for Excel for samfundsvidenskab åbner senere.

4095915;R for Absolute Beginners - ONLINE;FALSE;2022-11-06T10:00:00+01:00;2022-11-06T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.
Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

Link to online participation will be mailed to you two days before the course.

3908854;R and APIs - Statistics Denmark;FALSE;2022-11-08T12:00:00+01:00;2022-11-08T14:30:00+01:00;"

NOTE: The course has been postponed to the 8th of november.
APIs provide access to a multitude of information.
In this course we cover how to extract data though APIs using the Statistics Denmark API as an example.
The course material can be found on this website. Please make sure that you have followed the under "Setup" to install R and RStudio as well as some additional packages.
The course requires some previous knowledge of R. We will assume that you are familiar with:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself

column1:
These topics are covered in the course R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version, offerered on September 22nd and October 26th

3907844;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2022-11-09T12:30:00+01:00;2022-11-09T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3906809;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2022-11-17T10:00:00+01:00;2022-11-17T12:00:00+01:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3913006;Datasprint 2022: Cookies og dine data – hvad giver du samtykke til?;FALSE;2022-11-24T09:00:00+01:00;2022-11-24T16:00:00+01:00;"

Deltag i Det Kgl. Biblioteks Datasprint 2022 og vær med til at undersøge betingelserne for at færdes på internettet i form af de cookie- og privatlivspolitikker vi bliver bedt acceptere adskillige gange hver dag.
Vi har samlet et datasæt, der består af tekst fra cookie- og privatslivpolitikker, som man typisk vil blive bedt acceptere, når man bevæger sig rundt på internettet.

Datasprintet kan betragtes som et begynderkursus i text mining, men har man allerede erfaring inden for området, er man stadig mere end velkommen. Alle universitetsstuderende og -ansatte er velkomne til at tilmelde sig datasprintet, der foregår over to dage den 24. og 25. november. Begge dage fra kl. 9-16.
Det er gratis at deltage. Man forpligter sig dog til at deltage begge dage.
Tilmelding foregår fra denne side: https://datasprint.kb.dk/tilmelding

Hvis du har spørgsmål om arrangementet, så send dem til KUB DataLAB på e-mailadressen: kubdatalab@kb.dk

Vi har samlet et datasæt, der består af tekst fra cookie- og privatslivpolitikker, som man typisk vil blive bedt acceptere, når man bevæger sig rundt på internettet.

Datasprintet kan betragtes som et begynderkursus i text mining, men har man allerede erfaring inden for området, er man stadig mere end velkommen. Alle universitetsstuderende og -ansatte er velkomne til at tilmelde sig datasprintet, der foregår over to dage den 24. og 25. november.
Det er gratis at deltage. Man forpligter sig dog til at deltage begge dage.
Tilmelding foregår fra denne side: https://datasprint.kb.dk/tilmelding

Hvis du har spørgsmål om arrangementet, så send dem til KUB DataLAB på e-mailadressen: kubdatalab@kb.dk

3912429;NVivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2022-11-28T10:00:00+01:00;2022-11-28T12:00:00+01:00;"

NVivo has advanced features that can help qualitative researchers, but it can also help with analytical writing. In this workshop we focus on literature reviews, but the techniques and discussions we cover in the workshop can also be used when writing articles, conference papers, and student assignments. This is because NVivo helps you organize and “code” (categorize) your literature, identify concepts and visualize relationships between them and document your method. It can also be helpful in generating hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
At the end of the workshop participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes, classifications attributes and code books
• using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, and memoing
• performing queries and creating frameworks to allow you to compare coded material across different demographics or among themes

column1: Preperation for the workshop

Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your computer. Download and registration for students from the University of Copenhagen is via the UCPH Software Library.  Here you find a link to QSR International - Nvivo. Click on the link and accept the agreement.  You can now start the download and installation process. You'll see three text files:
1. Nvivoinstallation.txt - an empty file referring you to the instructions in Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt
2. Nvivo_Win-Mac_Vejledning.txt - follow the instructions in this file to install Nvivo
3. Nvivo_Win-Mac_License key 2022 - Save the licence key where you can find it. You'll need to copy/paste the key in a dialogue box during the installation process
In case of any difficulties in this process, please contact Copenhagen University’s Service desk.
Data needed for the workshop

You are also required to import a sample set of PDF articles into your reference manager that are available in the Absalon course room. Please find the Absalon course room and more information about how to prepare for the course HERE
Workshop design

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where especially for literature reviews the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can of course attend the course with a Mac but there will be some functions not available for you to use.
<ul>

The workshop "NVivo for your literature reviews" builds on participants’ knowledge gained from the introductory course - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). The introductory course is offered multiple times throughout the year in both Danish and English. If you are interested in working with interview data in NVivo, please attend the advanced NVivo course NVivo og interviewdata
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Related website with more workshops and tutorials
Course location: SAMF: Faculty Library for the Social Sciences, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K

/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3912429;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3912429;0;0;;40;KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K;NA;33563;Visualisation;38777;Lorna Wildgaard;;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;15;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;15;6;0;0;6;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571789.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA
Dette kursus er ikke et introducerende kursus, men forudsætter en grundlæggende forståelse for NVivos funktioner.
Denne forståelse kan evt. fås via deltagelse i vores introducerende NVivo-kurser, som findes her:
https://kubkalender.kb.dk/datalab
Vi kommer til at arbejde med transkribering af lydfiler, brug af cases og import af transkriberede interviews.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip).
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

Vi kommer til at arbejde med transkribering af lydfiler, brug af cases og import af transkriberede interviews.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip).
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3907874;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3907874;0;0;;40;KUB City Campus, Gothersgade 140, 1123 København K;NA;32027;Datalab;28221;Daniel Pryn;Daniel Pryn & Erik Schwägermann;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;22;TRUE;5673;FALSE;TRUE;TRUE;22;6;0;0;6;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1644571561.jpg;NA;0;;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3903858;Excel for samfundsvidenskab;FALSE;2022-11-30T10:30:00+01:00;2022-11-30T13:30:00+01:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data som tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:
Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365).
Vi forventer, at du har grundlæggende computer-færdigheder og erfaring med at bruge Microsoft-office, når du melder dig til kurset.

Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte. Det finder sted i Mødelokale Botanisk Have i stuetagen på biblioteket.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).
KU Absalonrum for Excel for samfundsvidenskab åbner senere.

3906795;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2022-12-07T13:00:00+01:00;2022-12-07T15:00:00+01:00;"
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3960074;ONLINE: Introduction to OpenRefine;FALSE;2023-01-09T10:00:00+01:00;2023-01-09T12:00:00+01:00;"<div class=""show-content user_content clearfix enhanced"">
An alternative to Excel: OpenRefine can do really cool stuff

MS Excel is a widely used tool for handling tabular data, but can also be a source of frustration. Often though the best solution may very well be to use OpenRefine and Excel in conjunction as they each have their own strengths and weaknesses.
OpenRefine handles datasets in a different way than Excel. This enables OpenRefine to help you with stuff that Excel cannot – e.g. make data entries consistent.
This introductory course will show you how to investigate your dataset in terms of e.g.:
<ul>

column2: • merge cells or split cells based on a delimiter or by field length

column1: During the two hour course you will be shown how to use OpenRefine to do the stuff above. The last part of the course you will have time to try out the functions on the dataset I use in my demonstration. You are also welcome to bring your own data that you want to work on.
Preparation for the course:
I expect that you have OpenRefine installed before the course, since we do not have time to do it at the course. See here how to install OpenRefine. The file is also attached.
After the course:

After the intro you can pick up the course manual and the dataset used in the course here. See and repeat the steps we took at your own pace. NB: the material is not available until after the introduction :-)

MS Excel is a widely used tool for handling tabular data, but can also be a source of frustration. Often though the best solution may very well be to use OpenRefine and Excel in conjunction as they each have their own strengths and weaknesses.
OpenRefine handles datasets in a different way than Excel. This enables OpenRefine to help you with stuff that Excel cannot – e.g. make data entries consistent.
This introductory course will show you how to investigate your dataset in terms of e.g.:
<ul>

column2: • merge cells or split cells based on a delimiter or by field length

column1: During the two hour course you will be shown how to use OpenRefine to do the stuff above. The last part of the course you will have time to try out the functions on the dataset I use in my demonstration. You are also welcome to bring your own data that you want to work on.
Preparation for the course:
I expect that you have OpenRefine installed before the course, since we do not have time to do it at the course. See here how to install OpenRefine. The file is also attached.
After the course:

After the intro you can pick up the course manual and the dataset used in the course here. See and repeat the steps we took at your own pace. NB: the material is not available until after the introduction :-)

3908958;Digital humaniora og programmering i Python 2;FALSE;2023-01-23T11:30:00+01:00;2023-01-23T13:30:00+01:00;"

Kurset gennemgår, hvordan man søge i tekster ved hjælp af ’regulære udtryk’ (RegEX). RegEX er super smarte, fordi man kan bruge dem til at trække udvalgte stykker tekst ud af en større tekstsamling, og på den måde er regulære udtryk meget anvendelige i forhold til tekst- og datamining. Udfordringen er at lære at formulere de regulære udtryk, men når man kommer i gang med udfordringen, er det sjovt, ’krøllet’ og spændende at opleve, hvordan man utroligt hurtigt kan fremfinde de passager i tekster, som man er interesseret i. Python understøtter regulære udtryk, så det er Python, der er kursets udgangspunkt. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurset Digital humaniora og programmering 1.

3908959;Digital humaniora og programmering i Python 3;FALSE;2023-01-23T14:00:00+01:00;2023-01-23T16:00:00+01:00;"

Kurset gennemgår nogle af Python-biblioteket Pandas’ mange muligheder. Pandas er et bibliotek i Python, som man benytter til at arbejde med data, der er struktureret i rækker og kolonner. Man vil ofte vælge at strukturere sine data i rækker og kolonner, hvis man har samlet meget data, og der findes også mange datasæt, som allerede er struktureret således. Med lidt kendskab til Pandas er man godt hjulpet på vej til at kunne give sig i kast med dataanalyse af større datasæt. På kurset gennemgår vi, hvordan man bygger en dataframe, samt hvordan man filtrerer, sammentæller og visualiserer sine data. Hvis man vil deltage på kurset, er det også en god idé at have deltaget på kurset Digital humaniora og programmering 1 og 2.

3997931;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2023-01-31T10:00:00+01:00;2023-01-31T12:00:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3999575;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2023-02-07T13:00:00+01:00;2023-02-07T15:00:00+01:00;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.
PC-versionen af NVivo har mere udvidet funktionalitet end Mac-versionen, men man kan deltage i alle øvelser uanset version, og undervisningen vil ligeledes blive demonstreret i begge.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret nyeste version af NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s Softwarebibliotek.
Bemærk: Vi arbejder i den nyeste version af NVivo, som i Sofwarebiblioteket hedder henholdsvis "NVivo 13 for Windows" og "NVivo for Mac M1chip" (man behøver dog ikke en M1-chip.)
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3999038;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2023-02-09T12:30:00+01:00;2023-02-09T14:30:00+01:00;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

4002292;PhD Cafe: Breaking new ground with new data methodologies;FALSE;2023-02-16T16:00:00+01:00;2023-02-16T19:00:00+01:00;"

You are cordially invited to a late-afternoon and evening of talks at KUB Datalab SAMF (The Faculty Library of Social Sciences’ datalab).
Anders Klindt Myrvoll, who works at the Danish Internet Archive, will open the event with a talk about the advantages and challenges of archiving the Danish-speaking web.
Afterwards, three PhDs will give insights into how they collect, clean, organize, and work with data to further their research.
Programme for the evening:
<ul>

column2: • Anders Klindt Myrvoll, Programme Manager Netarkivet – the national Danish web archive at the Royal Danish Library:
A status quo on harvesting, search, discovery, tools & data visualization. Adding value and meaning to a 1PB archive with 40+ billion objects using open source software SolrWayback
An introduction to automatically labelling images using deep learning in Python
Identifying latent classes with Gaussian Mixture Models
Online Ethnography Workflow: Relational Field Notes and Analysis with Obsidian

column1: There will be snacks and drinks, as well as the opportunity to mingle with the speakers and your friendly librarians after the talks.
Come and be inspired, learn new techniques, and/or mingle and network.
We look forward to seeing you!

4002292;PhD Cafe: Breaking new ground with new data methodologies;FALSE;2023-02-16T16:00:00+01:00;2023-02-16T19:00:00+01:00;"

You are cordially invited to a late-afternoon and evening of talks at KUB Datalab SAMF (The Faculty Library of Social Sciences’ datalab).
Anders Klindt Myrvoll, who works at the Danish Internet Archive, will open the event with a talk about the advantages and challenges of archiving the Danish-speaking web.
Afterwards, three PhDs will give insights into how they collect, clean, organize, and work with data to further their research.
Programme for the evening:
<ul>

column2: • Anders Klindt Myrvoll, Programme Manager Netarkivet – the national Danish web archive at the Royal Danish Library:
A status quo on harvesting, search, discovery, tools & data visualization. Adding value and meaning to a 1PB archive with 40+ billion objects using open source software SolrWayback
An introduction to automatically labelling images using deep learning in Python
Identifying latent classes with Gaussian Mixture Models
Online Ethnography Workflow: Relational Field Notes and Analysis with Obsidian

column1: There will be snacks and drinks, as well as the opportunity to mingle with the speakers and your friendly librarians after the talks.
Come and be inspired, learn new techniques, and/or mingle and network.
We look forward to seeing you!

3999338;Excel og samfundsvidenskabelig analyse;FALSE;2023-02-21T13:15:00+01:00;2023-02-21T15:45:00+01:00;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores workshop på Gothersgade. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet.
Excel er et stærkt talbehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller, diagrammer m.m. Vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data som tabeller og figurer m.m.
Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset:
Kurset er for KU-studerende. Medbring din laptop (Windows/Mac) og hav Excel installeret (Excel 2013/2016/2019/365).
Vi forventer, at du har grundlæggende computer-færdigheder og erfaring med at bruge Microsoft-office, når du melder dig til kurset.
Vi bruger de første 5-10 minutter på at opdatere din Excelsoftware, så kom med fra start. Kurset er på dansk og varer ca. to timer. Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.
Der er mindst tre kurser pr. semester. Hvis du er skrevet op, men ikke kan komme alligevel, så husk at melde fra, så er du sød (for der er tit kø).

3987812;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2023-02-22T12:30:00+01:00;2023-02-22T14:30:00+01:00;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3999577;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2023-02-22T13:00:00+01:00;2023-02-22T15:00:00+01:00;"
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Just download the Trial version and use the registration key available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3999578;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2023-03-07T13:00:00+01:00;2023-03-07T15:00:00+01:00;"
Introduction to NVivo; a program which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The PC version of NVivo has more functionality than the Mac version, but you can participate in all exercises with either and we will demonstrate in both.
Prior to the course, you must install the newest version of NVivo on your laptop. Just download the Trial version and use the registration key available through the UCPH Software Library.

Please note: We are working on the latest version of NVivo, which in the Software Library is called "NVivo 13 for Windows" and "NVivo for Mac M1chip" respectively (you do not need an M1 chip, however).
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)
